cards.html:
Hey Switchaboos! After Tropical Freeze last week, this week may be a little less exciting… but that doesn’t mean that there any good games coming out! Shantae: Half Genie Hero Ultimate Edition will be releasing this week along with Garage and One Piece: Pirate Warriors 3 – Deluxe Edition. So let’s get into it…

 

Note: All prices are in AUD and all release dates are for the Australian eShop. Also, releases can still be subjected to change after the release of this update.

 

Raging Justice

Release Date 05/08/18

Price $13.49

Developed By MakinGames Ltd

Published By Team17

Rating T

Genre Fighting / Action / Arcade

Required Space 901B

Players 1 – 2

Also Released On PC / PS4 / Xbox One

Raging Justice is a classic Beat ‘em Up game that features bone crushing combat and the ability to use weapons to wail on your opponents with. You can choose between playing by the books and arresting your foes or take the law into your own hands? So, which side will you choose?

 

Shantae: Half-Genie Hero Ultimate Edition

Release Date 05/08/18

Price $29.99

Developed By Way Forward

Published By Way Forward

Rating G

Genre Platformer / Adventure / Action

Required Space 2.7 GB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / PS4 / Xbox One

Now featuring all the DLC (including Pirate Queen’s Quest), this complete package of Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is a perfect way to jump into this kickstarted gem.

 

Death Road to Canada

Release Date 05/08/18

Price $11.99

Developed By Rocketcat Games / Madgarden

Published By Ukiyo Publishing

Rating T

Genre Action / Adventure

Required Space 160 MB

Players 1 – 2

Also Released On PC / iOS / Android / PS4 / Xbox One

This game is focussed around the concept of replayability as everything is randomized: locations, events, survivor appearances, personalities and even the story. However, the game doesn’t take itself too seriously. With up to 500 zombies to hunt down (or run from) at a time in 2-player co-op, this game is for anyone who loves mowing down zombies. That and you can teach a dog how to drive a car… sold!

 

Immortal Redneck

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $19.99

Developed By Crema

Published By Crema Games

Rating M

Genre First-Person Shooter / Shooter / Action

Required Space 1.9 GB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / PS4 / Xbox One

Immortal Redneck is a first-person shooter set in Egypt that features rogue-lite elements. Play as a redneck tourist who has suddenly woken up mummified in ancient Egypt. So you must fight your way through pyramids and take on oncoming mythological monsters never seen before.

 

Super Chariot

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $19.99

Developed By Frima Studio

Published By Microids

Rating E

Genre Platformer / Adventure / Action

Required Space 469 MB

Players 1 – 2

Also Released On PC / PS3 / PS4 / Xbox One / Wii U

Super Chariot is a beautiful 2D platformer with a unique twist. Play solo or co-op and guide the king’s coffin (with the king inside, of course) through 25 levels and five colourful environments.

 

Arcade Archives Terra Cresta

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $7.99

Developed By Nichibutsu

Published By Hamster

Rating E

Genre Shooter / Arcade

Required Space 76.0 MB

Players 1 – 2

Also Released On NES / PS2 / PS4 / Commodore 64 / ZX Spectrum / Arcade / Sharp X68000

Terra Cresta is a classic shoot ‘em up from the mid 80s. Take control of the Wing Galibur and take down enemy aircrafts and other machines on the ground. This game also features interesting powerups that will sure to amaze you.

 

Suicide Guy

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $7.99

Developed By Fabio Ferrara

Published By Chubby Pixel

Rating T

Genre Adventure / Puzzle

Required Space 2.1 GB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / PS4

Suicide Guy takes place entirely inside one man’s dreams. Encounter weird and wacky occurrences in order to save the thing you live most. The game features 25 levels that all rely on a unique physics-based engine.

 

ACA NeoGeo Super Sidekicks 2

Unfortunately, we were unable to find a trailer to ACA NeoGeo Super Sidekicks 2. However, we were able to find a trailer for the first time, which should give you an idea of the game’s mechanics. We apologise for any inconvenience.

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $7.99

Developed By SNK

Published By Hamster

Rating E

Genre Sports / Arcade

Required Space 104 MB

Players 1 – 2

Also Released On Arcade / Neo Geo / Neo Geo CD

Super Sidekicks 2 is a classic soccer game made by SNK in the mid 90s. With realistic gameplay and precise umpiring, Super Sidekicks 2 will be a sure pick for any soccer fan (when they’re not playing Fifa).

 

The Fall

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $6.99

Developed By Over The Moon

Published By Over The Moon

Rating T

Genre Adventure / Puzzle / Shooter

Required Space 466 MB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / Mac / Linux / PS4 / Xbox One / Android

Play as ARID, the artificial intelligence on board a high-tech combat suit that has crashed on an unknown planet. The Fall is unique for its storytelling and plot to which it was awarded Game of the Year for Storytelling by Giant Bomb. Dive into the deep unknown and see what lies beyond.

 

Garage

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $14.99

Developed By tinyBuild / Zombie Dynamics

Published By tinyBuild Games

Rating MA15+

Genre Shooter / Action / Adventure / RPG

Required Space 591 MB

Players 1

Garage is a Nintendo Switch exclusive that was featured in the latest Nintendo Nindies Showcase. Play as a drug dealer named Butch who must fight against hordes of zombies in the style of an 80s B-Grade movie. Find new weapons and master them to solve the mystery of the curse that has taken over. Garage is sure to satisfy that zombie-killing itch.

 

Three Fourths Home: Extended Edition

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $8.99

Developed By Bracket Games

Published By Digerati

Rating T

Genre Adventure / Other

Required Space 549 MB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / Linux / Mac / PS4 / PS Vita / Xbox One

This award-winning visual short story game explores the emotional ties of family relationships. Kelly has been forced to move back to Nebraska, so you must assume the role of her in the car as she drives through the storm.

 

Hyper Sentinel

Release Date 05/11/18

Price $12.99

Developed By Four5Six Pixel / Huey Games

Published By Huey Games

Rating G

Genre Arcade / Shooter / Action

Required Space 934 MB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / Mac / PS4 / iOS

Hyper Sentinel is an arcade shoot ‘em up love letter to the games of the arcade days. This game features awesome powerups and 60 challenging medals to earn across twelve adrenaline pumping levels.

 

One Piece: Pirate Warriors 3 – Deluxe Edition

Release Date 05/10/18

Price $39.99

Developed By Koei Tecmo / Omega Force

Published By Bandai Namco Entertainment

Rating T

Genre Action / Adventure / Fighting

Required Space 13.2 GB

Players 1 – 2

Also Released On PC / PS3 / PS4 / PS Vita

Fight waves of oncoming enemies in crazy Warriors style action in the world of One Piece. Relive the original story that began in Fushia Village all the way to the Kingdom of Dressrosa. This ultimate edition includes all of the original DLC, adding extra costumes and missions.

 

InkSplosion

Release Date 05/11/18

Price $3.99

Developed By Petite Games

Published By Ratalaika Games

Rating E

Genre Arcade / Shooter / Action

Required Space 142 MB

Players 1

Also Released On PC / PS4 / PS Vita / Xbox One

InkSplosion features endless levels of arcade fun that involves you firing ink to defeat your opponents. There are five different weapon types and three game modes for this easy to learn but difficult to master game.

 

Switchaboo Pick of the Week

It’s an interesting week for releases. A few ultimate editions and a few indie gems scattered in here and there. So we considered all of this and decided that our Pick of the Week is…

 

Drum roll, please…

 

Garage!

Whilst Garage might fly under radar for a lot of people, the fact that it is a Switch exclusive immediately catches the eye.

With a unique twist on the zombie genre in that it is set in the 80s and is a parody of the era’s B-grade horror films, Garage seems like a sure pick for any fan of the genre.

 

So, do you agree with our Pick of the Week? Let us know in the comments below.

And like always, please consider liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter @switchaboonews. Also, why not check out last week’s releases in case you missed them?
